comments:
That last few weeks I haven't been able to run any of the integration drops of
the GTK version of eclipse (2.1.1 maintenance branch). It gives me the below
error during startup.

I'm running the 2.1 GTK release without any problems at all.

My GTK version is gtk2-2.2.1-4 and gtk+-1.2.10-25, running on RedHat9 under KDE.
I recently switched to the GTK Mist theme, as the default BlueCurve caused
instability with the 2.1 release.

how many 2.1.1 drops did you try ? From where did you download them ?
It seems to me that you have a corrupt file, bad download or bad unzipping.
Could you run a MD5 check in the file to ensure its integrity ?

The one I'm having trouble starting gave me this output with md5sum:

eclipse-SDK-M20030430-linux-gtk.zip: OK

I've just pick up a few integration builds from time to time since the release
of 2.1, I deleted them as I found I couldn't start them. Still, the 2.1 release
runs like a dream.
problem loading an Image, Chris to investigate and advise.

Erik,

This looks similar to bug 36464 and bug 35852 which were caused by the KDE 
konqueror unzipper or the ark zipper tools.
Can you try unzipping the file from a shell console using this command:
(make sure you unzip onto a clean folder)
unzip eclipse-SDK-M20030430-linux-gtk.zip

Please let us know if this fixes it.

Chris

It works using unzip in the shell.

I looked at bug 36464 - this is the exact same problem.

Sorry to have wasted you time.

Regards
Erik


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 36464 ***
